definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Article 6 While recruiting labour-contract workers, the enterprise shall state explicitly in the contract a probational period.
sentences.chinese: 第六條企業招用勞動合同制工人，應當訂明試用期。

sentences.english: Note: This form should only be used by a prescribed person to apply for replacement of his registered emblem.
sentences.chinese: 此表格只適用於訂明人士申請代替其已登記的標誌。

sentences.english: Contractors are not required to propose the daily working hours in these contracts.
sentences.chinese: 合約內沒有訂明外判承辦商建議的每天工作時數。

sentences.english: Because of that, they're often prescribed for only short-term use.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他們往往訂明只有短期使用。

sentences.english: Note: This form should only be used by a prescribed body to apply for registration of its name and emblem.
sentences.chinese: 此表格只適用於訂明團體申請登記其名稱及標誌。

sentences.english: Only applicable when the objector makes an objection on behalf of an organization or a prescribed body.
sentences.chinese: 只適用於反對者是代表一個組織或訂明團體提出反對。

sentences.english: The physician came, prescribed for him, and went away.
sentences.chinese: 醫生來了，爲他訂明，就離開了。

sentences.english: This clause also sets out the indices contained in the DNA Databank.
sentences.chinese: 這項條文亦訂明DNA資料庫所包含的指標。

sentences.english: Note: This form should only be used by a prescribed person to apply for registration of his emblem.
sentences.chinese: 此表格只適用於訂明人士申請登記其標誌。
